prompts.title: Starter Prompts
prompts.subtitle: Copy these into Claude to get started. Customize the details in [brackets].

prompts.title: Update a Program Description
prompts.cmsSection: Services > Mental Health Services (or Restorative Justice Programs)
prompts.prompt:
I'm updating the Reach for Youth website. I need to rewrite the content for one of our programs in the CMS. The CMS has these fields for each service:

For Mental Health Services:
1. Title — the service name
2. Description — a paragraph about the service (under 150 words)
3. Service Items — a bullet list of specific offerings (e.g., "Individual therapy for youth ages 6-17")

For Restorative Justice Programs:
1. Title — the program name
2. Description — a paragraph about the program (under 150 words)
3. Features — a bullet list of key program components

I'm updating our [Mental Health / Restorative Justice] program. Here's what it does:
- [Describe the program in your own words]
- [Who it serves]
- [What makes it unique]

Audience: parents and families. Tone: warm, professional, hopeful — not clinical.

Please draft the title, description paragraph, AND the list of service items/features. Give me 2 versions to compare.

prompts.title: Update Impact Statistics
prompts.prompt:
I'm updating the Reach for Youth website statistics. The CMS organizes stats into three groups, each with Number + Label pairs:

Hero Stats (displayed prominently on the homepage):
- [Number]: [Label] (e.g., "950+" / "Youth Served Annually")
- [Number]: [Label]
- [Number]: [Label]

Impact Stats (program outcomes section):
- [Number]: [Label]
- [Number]: [Label]

Volunteer Stats (volunteer section):
- [Number]: [Label]
- [Number]: [Label]

Here are the numbers I want to update:
- [Paste your updated numbers and what they measure]

Please format each stat as a Number and Label pair. Numbers should be punchy (use + or abbreviations like "1.2K"). Labels should be concise — 2-4 words max.

Tell me which group each stat belongs in (Hero, Impact, or Volunteer).

prompts.title: Write a Volunteer Opportunity
prompts.prompt:
I'm adding a new volunteer opportunity to the Reach for Youth website. The CMS has two fields:

1. Title — the name of the volunteer role
2. Details — a bullet list of specifics about the role (what they'll do, time commitment, qualifications, etc.)

Here's the role I want to add:
- [Describe the volunteer role]
- [Time commitment]
- [Any requirements or ideal qualities]

Please draft the title and a list of 3-5 detail bullets. Tone should be welcoming and specific — make someone want to sign up. Avoid jargon.

Please draft 2 versions for me to choose from.

prompts.title: Add a Timeline Entry
prompts.prompt:
I'm adding a new milestone to the Reach for Youth website timeline. Here's the event:

- Year: [Year]
- What happened: [Describe the milestone]
- Why it matters: [Why this was significant for RFY]

Please write a 1-2 sentence description that captures both what happened and why it mattered. Match the tone of a nonprofit celebrating its growth — proud but humble.

prompts.title: Summarize Meeting Notes
prompts.prompt:
Summarize these meeting notes. Pull out:
- Key decisions made
- Action items with owners and deadlines
- Open questions that still need answers
- Any topics that were tabled for later

Format it so I can paste it into an email to the team.

[Paste your meeting notes here]

prompts.title: Prepare Meeting Agenda
prompts.prompt:
Help me create an agenda for a [type of meeting] with [who's attending].

Topics to cover:
- [Topic 1]
- [Topic 2]
- [Topic 3]

The meeting is [duration] long. Include time estimates for each item and leave 5 minutes at the end for action items. Put the most important topic first.

prompts.title: Internal Update Email
prompts.prompt:
Draft an internal email to department leads about [topic].
Tone: professional but warm, like how our COO writes.
Keep it under 200 words. Include a clear ask at the end.

Key points to cover:
- [Point 1]
- [Point 2]
- [Point 3]

prompts.title: Follow-Up Email
prompts.prompt:
Draft a follow-up email after today's meeting about [topic].

Include:
- Brief thank-you for attending
- Summary of what we decided (2-3 bullet points)
- Next steps with who's responsible
- Deadline or next meeting date

Keep it concise — people skim emails. Tone should be [friendly/formal/direct].

prompts.title: Program Description for Grant
prompts.prompt:
Help me write a program description for a grant application.

Program name: [Name]
What it does: [Description]
Who it serves: [Population]
Key outcomes: [What results has it produced?]

The funder cares about: [what the funder values — equity, outcomes, innovation, etc.]

Write 250-300 words. Use data where I've provided it. Tone should be confident and evidence-based, not salesy.

prompts.title: Multi-Audience Rewrite
prompts.prompt:
Here's our [program name] program description. Rewrite it three ways:
1. For our website (parents are the audience)
2. For a grant application (funders are the audience)
3. For a staff recruitment posting (potential employees are the audience)

[Paste description]

Keep each version under 200 words. Adjust tone and emphasis for each audience.

prompts.title: Format a Report
prompts.prompt:
Help me clean up and format this report. I need:
- A clear executive summary (3-4 sentences)
- Consistent heading structure
- Bullet points instead of long paragraphs where appropriate
- Any data presented in a table format

Keep my content — just make it more readable.

[Paste your draft report]

prompts.title: Create a One-Pager
prompts.prompt:
Create a one-page summary of our [program/initiative]. Include:
- What it is (2-3 sentences)
- Who it serves
- Key outcomes/impact (use numbers if available)
- How to get involved or learn more

This will be shared with [audience]. Make it scannable — use headers and bullet points. Keep it to one page when printed.

Here's the information to work from:
[Paste your content]

websiteGuide.title: Website Update Guide
websiteGuide.overview: The workflow has two parts: draft content with Claude, then publish it through the CMS. No coding, no terminal, no technical skills required.

prerequisites.detail: Sign up free at github.com/signup. This is your login for the CMS.
Victor adds you to the website repository. You'll get an email invitation — accept it.
Download at claude.ai/download. This is where you draft content.

workflow.title: Draft with Claude
workflow.description: Open Claude Desktop. Copy a starter prompt from the Prompts page. Paste it in, customize the details, and iterate until you're happy with the output.

workflow.title: Open the CMS
workflow.description: Go to the CMS in your browser. Click "Login with GitHub" and authorize access. First time? You may also need to grant org access — see Troubleshooting below.

workflow.title: Find your section
workflow.description: The CMS has labeled sections matching the website. Navigate to the section you're updating.

workflow.title: Paste and publish
workflow.description: Paste Claude's output into the form fields. Review it one more time. Click Publish.

workflow.title: See it live
workflow.description: Refresh the website. Your changes should appear within 30-60 seconds.

sections.name: Statistics
sections.description: Homepage numbers — youth served, programs, volunteers

sections.path: Services > Mental Health Services (or Restorative Justice Programs)

troubleshooting.problem: CMS won't load or shows a blank page
troubleshooting.solution: Try a different browser (Chrome works best). Clear cache and try again.
Make sure you accepted the collaborator invitation email. Check spam. Try incognito mode.

troubleshooting.problem: Changes aren't showing on the website
troubleshooting.solution: Wait 30-60 seconds, then hard refresh (Cmd+Shift+R on Mac, Ctrl+Shift+R on Windows).
If someone else published at the same time, wait 30 seconds and try again.
Don't worry — Victor can revert any change. Just let him know.

troubleshooting.problem: Publish fails or CMS is read-only
troubleshooting.solution: Go to GitHub Settings → Applications → 'RFY Website CMS' → click 'Grant' for thewicksproject. Log out of the CMS and back in.

walkthrough.intro: This page walks through the exact steps to update the RFY website. Each section shows what you'll see and what to do. The full loop takes about 5 minutes.
walkthrough.examplePrompt:
I'm updating the Reach for Youth volunteer page. I need to add a new volunteer opportunity to the CMS.

The CMS has these fields for each opportunity:
1. Title — the role name
2. Details — 3-5 bullet points (what they'll do, time commitment, qualifications)

New role to add:
- Youth Workshop Facilitator
- Saturday mornings, twice per month
- Leading life-skills workshops for teens 13-17
- No experience needed, training provided

Write the title and 3 detail bullets. Welcoming tone. Draft 2 versions so I can pick my favorite.
